title: Sing-box v1.13.0-rc.4 Configuration
description: Sing-box v1.13.0-rc.4 configuration file schema. Sing-box uses JSON for configuration files with log, dns, ntp, certificate, endpoints, inbounds, outbounds, route, services, and experimental sections.

LogOptions.title: Log
LogOptions.description: Log settings covering disabled, level, output, and timestamp controls for sing-box.

disabled.description: Disable logging, no output after start.

output.description: Output file path. Will not write log to console after enable.

final.description: Default DNS server tag. The first server will be used if empty.

reverse_mapping.description: Stores a reverse mapping of IP addresses after responding to a DNS query in order to provide domain names when routing. Since this process relies on the act of resolving domain names by an application before making a request, it can be problematic in environments such as macOS, where DNS is proxied and cached by the system.

strategy.description: Default domain strategy for resolving the domain names. One of `prefer_ipv4` `prefer_ipv6` `ipv4_only` `ipv6_only`.

independent_cache.description: Make each DNS server's cache independent for special purposes. If enabled, will slightly degrade performance.

cache_capacity.description: LRU cache capacity. Value less than 1024 will be ignored.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default. If the value is an IP address instead of a prefix, `/32` or `/128` will be appended automatically. Can be overridden by `servers.[].client_subnet` or `rules.[].client_subnet`.

prefer_go.description: When enabled, `local` DNS server will resolve DNS by dialing itself whenever possible.

__schema0.description: The tag of the upstream outbound. If enabled, all other dialer fields will be ignored.

__schema1.description: The network interface to bind to.

__schema2.description: The IPv4 address to bind to.

__schema3.description: The IPv6 address to bind to.

__schema4.description: Set netfilter routing mark. Only supported on Linux; accepts integers (e.g. `1234`) or hexadecimal strings (e.g. `"0x1234").

__schema7.description: Do not reserve a port when binding to a source address. This allows reusing the same source port for multiple connections if the full 4-tuple (source IP, source port, destination IP, destination port) remains unique.

__schema8.description: Path to send protect file descriptor to on Android.

__schema9.description: Set network namespace, name or path. Only supported on Linux.

__schema10.description: Connect timeout, in golang's Duration format (e.g. `300ms`, `-1.5h`, `2h45m`).

__schema15.description: TCP keep alive initial period. `5m` will be used by default.

__schema16.description: TCP keep alive interval. `75s` will be used by default.

__schema17.description: Set domain resolver to use for resolving domain names. This option uses the same format as the route DNS rule action without the `action` field, and specifying a string is equivalent to filling its `server`. Optional when only one DNS server is configured. For `direct`, it resolves domains in the request; other outbound types resolve domains in the server address.

DomainResolverOptions.title: Domain Resolver Options
DomainResolverOptions.description: Domain resolver configuration used by dialers; follows the same format as the route DNS rule action without the `action` field, and setting a string is equivalent to specifying `server`.

server.description: Tag of a another server to resolve the domain name in the address.

strategy.description: The domain strategy for resolving the domain name in the address.

disable_cache.description: Disable cache and save cache in this query.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default.

__schema18.description: Default domain strategy for resolving the domain names.

__schema19.description: Strategy for selecting network interfaces. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled. Available values: `default` (default) connects to the default network or the networks specified in `network_type` sequentially, `hybrid` connects to all networks or the networks specified in `network_type` concurrently, and `fallback` connects to the default network or preferred networks specified in `network_type` concurrently and tries fallback networks when they are unavailable or timeout, entering a 15s fast fallback state that exits immediately if preferred networks recover. Conflicts with `bind_interface`, `inet4_bind_address`, and `inet6_bind_address`.

NetworkStrategy.title: Network Strategy
NetworkStrategy.description: Strategy for selecting network interfaces. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled. `default` connects to default or `network_type` sequentially, `hybrid` connects concurrently, and `fallback` probes preferred/fallback networks (entering a 15s fast fallback). Conflicts with `bind_interface`, `inet4_bind_address` and `inet6_bind_address`.

network_type.description: Network types to use when `default` or `hybrid` strategies are selected, or preferred types when `fallback` is used. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled.

fallback_network_type.description: Fallback network types used when preferred networks fail or timeout in the `fallback` strategy. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled.

fallback_delay.description: The length of time to wait before spawning a RFC 6555 Fast Fallback connection or falling back to another interface when `domain_strategy` or `network_strategy` is in use. Defaults to `300ms`.

__schema21.description: Network types to use when `default` or `hybrid` strategies are selected, or preferred types when `fallback` is enabled. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled. Available values: `wifi`, `cellular`, `ethernet`, `other`. Device's default network is used by default.

__schema22.description: Fallback network types when preferred networks are unavailable or timeout while using the `fallback` strategy. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms with `auto_detect_interface` enabled. All other networks except preferred are used by default.

__schema23.description: The length of time to wait before spawning a RFC 6555 Fast Fallback connection. For `domain_strategy`, it is the amount of time to wait for a connection to succeed before assuming the preferred address is misconfigured and falling back. For `network_strategy`, it is the amount of time to wait before falling back to other interfaces. Only takes effect when `domain_strategy` or `network_strategy` is set. `300ms` is used by default.

__schema24.description: Default domain strategy for resolving the domain names. Deprecated in sing-box 1.12.0 and removed in 1.14.0. Available values: `prefer_ipv4`, `prefer_ipv6`, `ipv4_only`, `ipv6_only`. `direct` falls back to `inbound.domain_strategy` when unset while other types only affect server addresses.

path.description: List of paths to hosts files. `/etc/hosts` is used by default on Unix and `C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\etc\hosts` is used by default on Windows.

server.description: The address of the TCP DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the TCP DNS server. `53` will be used by default.

server.description: The address of the UDP DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the UDP DNS server. `53` will be used by default.

server.description: The address of the TLS DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the TLS DNS server. `853` will be used by default.

disable_sni.description: Do not send server name in ClientHello (client only).

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates unless insecure is given.

alpn.description: List of supported application level protocols, in order of preference.

min_version.description: The minimum TLS version that is acceptable.

max_version.description: The maximum TLS version that is acceptable.

cipher_suites.description: A list of enabled TLS 1.0–1.2 cipher suites.

curve_preferences.description: Set of supported key exchange mechanisms.

certificate.description: The server certificate line array, in PEM format.

certificate_path.description: The path to the server certificate, in PEM format. Will be automatically reloaded if the file is modified.

certificate_public_key_sha256.description: SHA-256 fingerprints of trusted server certificate public keys.

client_certificate.description: Client certificate line array, in PEM format.

client_certificate_path.description: Path to the client certificate, in PEM format.

client_key.description: Client private key line array, in PEM format.

client_key_path.description: Path to the client private key, in PEM format.

fragment.description: Fragment TLS handshakes to bypass plain-text based firewalls. Poor performance means `record_fragment` should be tried first. On Linux, Apple platforms, and Windows (with admin privileges) the wait time is auto detected; otherwise it falls back to `fragment_fallback_delay`, and values below 20ms also defer to the fallback delay.

fragment_fallback_delay.description: The fallback value used when TLS segmentation cannot automatically determine the wait time. Defaults to `500ms`.

record_fragment.description: Fragment TLS handshake into multiple TLS records to bypass firewalls. Preferred over `fragment` when performance is a concern.

config.description: ECH configuration line array, in PEM format. If empty, sing-box will attempt to load the configuration from DNS.

config_path.description: The path to ECH configuration, in PEM format. If empty, sing-box will attempt to load the configuration from DNS.

query_server_name.description: Overrides the domain name used for ECH HTTPS record queries.

enabled.description: Enable uTLS (not recommended; uTLS has known fingerprinting vulnerabilities).

fingerprint.description: uTLS fingerprint used by the ClientHello (not recommended).

public_key.description: Public key, generated by `sing-box generate reality-keypair`.

short_id.description: A hexadecimal string with zero to eight digits.

server.description: The address of the QUIC DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the QUIC DNS server. `853` will be used by default.

server.description: The address of the HTTPS DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the HTTPS DNS server. `443` will be used by default.

path.description: The path of the HTTPS DNS server. `/dns-query` will be used by default.

method.description: The HTTP method for DNS-over-HTTPS requests.

headers.description: Additional headers to be sent to the DNS server.

server.description: The address of the HTTP3 DNS server. If a domain name is used, `domain_resolver` must also be set to resolve the IP address.

server_port.description: The port of the HTTP3 DNS server. `443` will be used by default.

path.description: The path of the HTTP3 DNS server. `/dns-query` will be used by default.

headers.description: Additional headers to be sent to the DNS server.

interface.description: Interface name to listen on. The default interface will be used when empty.

endpoint.description: The tag of the Tailscale Endpoint.

accept_default_resolvers.description: Indicates whether default DNS resolvers should be accepted for fallback queries in addition to MagicDNS. If not enabled, `NXDOMAIN` will be returned for non-Tailscale domain queries.

service.description: The tag of the Resolved Service.

accept_default_resolvers.description: Indicates whether the default DNS resolvers should be accepted for fallback queries in addition to matching domains. Specifically, default DNS resolvers are DNS servers that have `SetLinkDefaultRoute` or `SetLinkDomains ~.` set. If not enabled, `NXDOMAIN` will be returned for requests that do not match search or match domains.

LegacyDNSServer.title: Legacy DNS Server
LegacyDNSServer.description: Legacy DNS servers is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.14.0, check Migration.

tag.description: The tag of the dns server.

address.description: The address of the dns server.

address_resolver.description: Tag of another server to resolve the domain name in the address. Required if the address contains a domain.

address_strategy.description: The domain strategy for resolving the domain name in the address. One of `prefer_ipv4` `prefer_ipv6` `ipv4_only` `ipv6_only`. `dns.strategy` will be used if empty.

strategy.description: Default domain strategy for resolving the domain names. One of `prefer_ipv4` `prefer_ipv6` `ipv4_only` `ipv6_only`. Takes no effect if overridden by other settings.

detour.description: Tag of an outbound for connecting to the dns server. Default outbound will be used if empty.

address_fallback_delay.description: The time to wait for a response from the primary upstream DNS server before trying a fallback resolver.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default. If the value is an IP address instead of a prefix, `/32` or `/128` will be appended automatically. Can be overridden by `rules.[].client_subnet`. Will override `dns.client_subnet`.

strategy.description: Set domain strategy for this query. One of `prefer_ipv4` `prefer_ipv6` `ipv4_only` `ipv6_only`.

disable_cache.description: Disable cache and save cache in this query.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default. If the value is an IP address instead of a prefix, `/32` or `/128` will be appended automatically. Will override `dns.client_subnet`.

strategy.description: Set domain strategy for this query. One of `prefer_ipv4` `prefer_ipv6` `ipv4_only` `ipv6_only`.

disable_cache.description: Disable cache and save cache in this query.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default. If the value is an IP address instead of a prefix, `/32` or `/128` will be appended automatically. Will override `dns.client_subnet`.

method.description: `default`: Reply with REFUSED. `drop`: Drop the request. `default` will be used by default.

no_drop.description: If not enabled, `method` will be temporarily overwritten to `drop` after 50 triggers in 30s.

answer.description: List of text DNS record to respond as answers.

ns.description: List of text DNS record to respond as name servers.

extra.description: List of text DNS record to respond as extra records.

__schema34.description: DNS query type. Values can be integers or type name strings.

__schema39.description: Sniffed protocol, see Protocol Sniff (/configuration/route/sniff/) for details.

__schema44.description: Match geosite. Geosite is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.12.0, check Migration (/migration/#migrate-geosite-to-rule-sets).

__schema45.description: Match source geoip. GeoIP is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.12.0, check Migration (/migration/#migrate-geoip-to-rule-sets).

__schema46.description: Match geoip. GeoIP is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.12.0, check Migration (/migration/#migrate-geoip-to-rule-sets).

__schema49.description: Match IP CIDR with query response. Only takes effect for address requests (A/AAAA/HTTPS).

__schema50.description: Match private IP with query response. Only takes effect for address requests (A/AAAA/HTTPS).

__schema51.description: Match any IP with query response. Only takes effect for address requests (A/AAAA/HTTPS).

__schema58.description: Match process name. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

__schema59.description: Match process path. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

__schema60.description: Match process path using regular expression. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

__schema62.description: Match user name. Only supported on Linux.

__schema63.description: Match user id. Only supported on Linux.

__schema65.description: Match network type. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Available values: `wifi`, `cellular`, `ethernet` and `other`.

__schema66.description: Match if network is considered Metered (on Android) or considered expensive, such as Cellular or a Personal Hotspot (on Apple platforms). Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms.

__schema67.description: Match if network is in Low Data Mode. Only supported in graphical clients on Apple platforms.

__schema68.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms, or on Linux. Match WiFi SSID. See [Wi-Fi State](/configuration/shared/wifi-state/) for details.

__schema69.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms, or on Linux. Match WiFi BSSID. See [Wi-Fi State](/configuration/shared/wifi-state/) for details.

__schema70.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Match interface address.

__schema71.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Matches network interface (same values as `network_type`) address.

__schema72.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Match default interface address.

__schema74.description: Make `ip_cidr` rule items in rule-sets match the source IP.

__schema75.description: Make `ip_cidr` rules in rule-sets accept empty query response. Only takes effect for address requests (A/AAAA/HTTPS).

__schema77.description: Match outbound. Deprecated in sing-box 1.12.0; moved to DNS Rule Action (/configuration/dns/rule_action#route). `any` can be used as a value to match any outbound.

NTPOptions.title: NTP
NTPOptions.description: Built-in NTP client service. If enabled, it will provide time for protocols like TLS/Shadowsocks/VMess, which is useful for environments where time synchronization is not possible.

interval.description: Time synchronization interval. 30 minutes is used by default.

write_to_system.description: Write the updated time to the system.

CertificateOptions.title: Certificate
CertificateOptions.description: Certificate settings for customizing trusted CA lists and PEM data, introduced in sing-box 1.12.0.

store.description: The default X509 trusted CA certificate list. Options: `system` (System trusted CA certificates), `mozilla` (Mozilla Included List with China CA certificates removed), `none` (Empty list).

certificate.description: The certificate line array to trust, in PEM format.

certificate_path.description: The paths to certificates to trust, in PEM format. Will be automatically reloaded if file modified.

certificate_directory_path.description: The directory path to search for certificates to trust, in PEM format. Will be automatically reloaded if file modified.

Endpoint.title: Endpoint
Endpoint.description: An endpoint is a protocol with inbound and outbound behavior.

system.description: Use system interface. Requires privilege and cannot conflict with existing system interfaces.

name.description: Custom interface name for system interface.

mtu.description: WireGuard MTU. `1408` will be used by default.

address.description: List of IP (v4 or v6) address prefixes to be assigned to the interface. Required.

private_key.description: WireGuard requires base64-encoded public and private keys. These can be generated using wg(8) or `sing-box generate wg-keypair`. Required.

public_key.description: WireGuard peer public key. Required if the peer is configured without server multi-peer support.

persistent_keepalive_interval.description: WireGuard persistent keepalive interval, in seconds. Disabled by default.

udp_timeout.description: UDP NAT expiration time. `5m` will be used by default.

workers.description: WireGuard worker count. CPU count is used by default.

state_directory.description: The directory where the Tailscale state is stored. `tailscale` is used by default. Example: $HOME/.tailscale.

auth_key.description: Auth key is not required. By default, sing-box will log the login URL (or popup a notification on graphical clients). The auth key to create the node. If the node is already created (from state previously stored), then this field is not used.

control_url.description: The coordination server URL. `https://controlplane.tailscale.com` is used by default.

ephemeral.description: Indicates whether the instance should register as an Ephemeral node (https://tailscale.com/s/ephemeral-nodes).

hostname.description: The hostname of the node. System hostname is used by default. Example: `localhost`.

accept_routes.description: Indicates whether the node should accept routes advertised by other nodes.

exit_node.description: The exit node name or IP address to use.

exit_node_allow_lan_access.description: When the exit node does not have a corresponding advertised route, private traffics cannot be routed to the exit node even if `exit_node_allow_lan_access` is set. Indicates whether locally accessible subnets should be routed directly or via the exit node.

advertise_routes.description: CIDR prefixes to advertise into the Tailscale network as reachable through the current node. Example: ["192.168.1.1/24"].

advertise_exit_node.description: Indicates whether the node should advertise itself as an exit node.

advertise_tags.description: ACL tags to request when registering the node. Tags must be pre-authorized in the Tailscale ACL policy. Example: `["tag:server", "tag:prod"]`.

relay_server_port.description: The port to listen on for incoming relay connections from other Tailscale nodes.

relay_server_static_endpoints.description: Static endpoints to advertise for the relay server.

system_interface.description: Create a system TUN interface for Tailscale.

system_interface_name.description: Custom TUN interface name. By default, `tailscale` (or `utun` on macOS) will be used.

system_interface_mtu.description: Override the TUN MTU. By default, Tailscale's own MTU is used.

udp_timeout.description: UDP NAT expiration time. `5m` will be used by default.

Inbound.title: Inbound
Inbound.description: Inbound configuration entries represent listeners for supported transport protocols. Each entry selects a protocol via `type` and can be labeled with `tag` for routing.

DirectInboundOptions.title: Direct Inbound
DirectInboundOptions.description: Direct inbound is a tunnel server.

network.description: Listen network, one of `tcp` `udp`. Both networks are enabled when empty.

__schema84.description: The network interface to bind to.

__schema85.description: Set netfilter routing mark. Only supported on Linux; accepts integers (e.g. `1234`) or hexadecimal strings (e.g. `"0x1234").

__schema87.description: Set network namespace, name or path. Only supported on Linux.

__schema89.description: TCP keep alive initial period. `5m` will be used by default.

__schema90.description: TCP keep alive interval. `75s` will be used by default.

__schema94.description: UDP NAT expiration time. `5m` will be used by default.

__schema96.description: Accept connections without proxy protocol header.

__schema97.description: Enable sniffing. Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0 and removed in 1.13.0.

__schema98.description: Override the connection destination address with the sniffed domain. Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0 and removed in 1.13.0.

__schema99.description: Timeout for sniffing (default `300ms`). Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0 and removed in 1.13.0.

__schema100.description: If set, the requested domain name will be resolved to IP before routing. Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0 and removed in 1.13.0.

__schema101.description: If enabled, for UDP proxy requests addressed to a domain, the original packet address will be sent in the response instead of the mapped domain. Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0 and removed in 1.13.0.

__schema102.description: If set, connections will be forwarded to the specified inbound. Requires target inbound support.

MixedInboundOptions.title: Mixed Inbound
MixedInboundOptions.description: `mixed` inbound is a socks4, socks4a, socks5 and http server.

users.description: SOCKS and HTTP users. No authentication required if empty.

set_system_proxy.description: Automatically set system proxy configuration when start and clean up when stop. Only supported on Linux, Android, Windows, and macOS. To work on Android and Apple platforms without privileges, use tun.platform.http_proxy instead.

domain_resolver.description: Set domain resolver to use for resolving domain names.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates unless `insecure` is given. Also included in the client's handshake to support virtual hosting unless it is an IP address.

alpn.description: List of supported application level protocols, in order of preference.

min_version.description: The minimum TLS version that is acceptable.

max_version.description: The maximum TLS version that is acceptable.

cipher_suites.description: A list of enabled TLS 1.0–1.2 cipher suites.

curve_preferences.description: Set of supported key exchange mechanisms.

certificate.description: The server certificate line array, in PEM format.

certificate_path.description: The path to the server certificate, in PEM format. Will be automatically reloaded if the file is modified.

client_authentication.description: The type of client authentication to use.

client_certificate.description: Client certificate line array to trust, in PEM format.

client_certificate_path.description: Paths to client certificates to trust, in PEM format.

client_certificate_public_key_sha256.description: SHA-256 fingerprints of trusted client certificate public keys.

key.description: The server private key line array, in PEM format.

key_path.description: The path to the server private key, in PEM format. Will be automatically reloaded if the file is modified.

data_directory.description: The directory to store ACME data.

default_server_name.description: Server name to use when choosing a certificate if the ClientHello's ServerName field is empty.

email.description: The email address to use when creating or selecting an existing ACME server account.

provider.description: The ACME CA provider to use.

alternative_http_port.description: The alternate port to use for the ACME HTTP challenge.

alternative_tls_port.description: The alternate port to use for the ACME TLS-ALPN challenge.

external_account.description: EAB (External Account Binding) contains information necessary to bind or map an ACME account to some other account known by the CA.

key.description: ECH key line array, in PEM format.

key_path.description: The path to ECH key, in PEM format.

handshake.description: Handshake server address and Dial Fields.

private_key.description: Private key, generated by `sing-box generate reality-keypair`.

short_id.description: A hexadecimal string with zero to eight digits.

max_time_difference.description: The maximum time difference between the server and the client.

SocksInboundOptions.title: SOCKS Inbound
SocksInboundOptions.description: `socks` inbound is a socks4, socks4a, socks5 server.

users.description: SOCKS users. No authentication required if empty.

domain_resolver.description: Set domain resolver to use for resolving domain names.

users.description: HTTP users. No authentication required if empty.

domain_resolver.description: Set domain resolver to use for resolving domain names.

set_system_proxy.description: Automatically set system proxy configuration when start and clean up when stop. Only supported on Linux, Android, Windows, and macOS. To work on Android and Apple platforms without privileges, use tun.platform.http_proxy instead.

network.description: Listen network, one of `tcp` `udp`. Both are enabled when empty.

method.description: Encryption method. Supported values include 2022 variants (`2022-blake3-*`), AES-GCM/ChaCha20, and legacy methods. See docs for the full list.

password.description: Shadowsocks password. 2022 methods expect base64 data generated via `sing-box generate rand --base64 <Key Length>`.

users.description: Shadowsocks users. No authentication required if empty.

destinations.description: Relay destinations. Each entry includes a name, server address, server_port, and password.

managed.description: Defaults to `false`. Enable when the inbound is managed by the SSM API for dynamic users.

padding.description: If enabled, non-padded connections will be rejected.

BrutalOptions.title: Brutal Options
BrutalOptions.description: Options for the TCP Brutal congestion control algorithm. Linux with the brutal kernel module is required.

enabled.description: Enable TCP Brutal congestion control algorithm. Requires Linux with the brutal kernel module installed.

users.description: VMess users. Alter ID 0 disables legacy protocol, >0 enables legacy protocol, and legacy protocol support is for compatibility only (alterId > 1 is not recommended).

alterId.description: Alter ID. 0 disables the legacy protocol, >0 enables the legacy protocol, and legacy protocol support is for compatibility only (alterId > 1 is not recommended).

idle_timeout.description: Specifies the time until idle clients should be closed with a GOAWAY frame.

ping_timeout.description: Specifies the timeout duration after sending a PING frame, within which a response must be received.

max_early_data.description: Allowed payload size is in the request.

early_data_header_name.description: Early data is sent in path instead of header by default.

idle_timeout.description: If the transport doesn't see any activity after a duration of this time, it pings the client to check if the connection is still active.

ping_timeout.description: The timeout that after performing a keepalive check, the client will wait for activity.

permit_without_stream.description: If enabled, the client transport sends keepalive pings even with no active connections.

fallback.description: There is no evidence that GFW detects and blocks Trojan servers based on HTTP responses, and opening the standard http/s port on the server is a much bigger signature. Fallback server configuration. Disabled if `fallback` and `fallback_for_alpn` are empty.

fallback_for_alpn.description: Fallback server configuration for specified ALPN. If not empty, TLS fallback requests with ALPN not in this table will be rejected.

network.description: Listen network, one of `tcp` `udp`. Both networks are enabled when empty.

up.description: Upstream bandwidth limit, format `[Integer] [Unit]` (e.g. `100 Mbps`). Supported units: bps, Bps, Kbps, KBps, Mbps, MBps, Gbps, GBps, Tbps, TBps.

up_mbps.description: Max upstream bandwidth, in Mbps. Required.

down.description: Downstream bandwidth limit, format `[Integer] [Unit]` (e.g. `100 Mbps`). Supported units: bps, Bps, Kbps, KBps, Mbps, MBps, Gbps, GBps, Tbps, TBps.

down_mbps.description: Max downstream bandwidth, in Mbps. Required.

recv_window_conn.description: The QUIC stream-level flow control window for receiving data. `15728640 (15 MB/s)` will be used if empty.

recv_window_client.description: The QUIC connection-level flow control window for receiving data. `67108864 (64 MB/s)` will be used if empty.

max_conn_client.description: The maximum number of QUIC concurrent bidirectional streams that a peer is allowed to open. `1024` will be used if empty.

disable_mtu_discovery.description: Disables Path MTU Discovery (RFC 8899). Packets will then be at most 1252 (IPv4) / 1232 (IPv6) bytes in size. Force enabled on for systems other than Linux and Windows.

version.description:
ShadowTLS protocol version.

| Value         | Protocol Version                                                                        |
|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `1` (default) | [ShadowTLS v1](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-en.md#v1) |
| `2`           | [ShadowTLS v2](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-en.md#v2) |
| `3`           | [ShadowTLS v3](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-v3-en.md) |

password.description: ShadowTLS password. Only available in the ShadowTLS protocol 2.

users.description: ShadowTLS users. Only available in the ShadowTLS protocol 3.

handshake.description: When `wildcard_sni` is configured to `all`, the server address is optional. Handshake server address and [Dial Fields](/configuration/shared/dial/).

handshake_for_server_name.description: Handshake server address and [Dial Fields](/configuration/shared/dial/) for specific server name. Only available in the ShadowTLS protocol 2/3.

strict_mode.description: ShadowTLS strict mode. Only available in the ShadowTLS protocol 3.

wildcard_sni.description: ShadowTLS wildcard SNI mode (since sing-box 1.12.0). Values: `off` (default), `authed`, `all`. Authenticated connections will have their destination overwritten to `(servername):443` when enabled, except when `handshake_for_server_name` matches.

up_mbps.description: Max bandwidth, in Mbps. Not limited if empty. Conflicts with `ignore_client_bandwidth`.

down_mbps.description: Max bandwidth, in Mbps. Not limited if empty. Conflicts with `ignore_client_bandwidth`.

ignore_client_bandwidth.description:
*When `up_mbps` and `down_mbps` are not set*: Commands clients to use the BBR CC instead of Hysteria CC.
*When `up_mbps` and `down_mbps` are set*: Deny clients to use the BBR CC.

masquerade.description: HTTP3 server behavior when authentication fails. Accepts a URL string shorthand (file:// or http(s)://) or a full masquerade object. Conflicts with `masquerade.type`. A 404 page will be returned if masquerade is not configured.

anyOf.description: HTTP3 server behavior (Object configuration) when authentication fails. Types: `file` (directory), `proxy` (url, rewrite_host), `string` (status_code, headers, content). Conflicts with `masquerade`. A 404 page will be returned if not configured.

rewrite_host.description: Rewrite the `Host` header to the target URL.

brutal_debug.description: Enable debug information logging for Hysteria Brutal CC.

type.description: QUIC traffic obfuscator type, only available with `salamander`. Disabled if empty.

congestion_control.description: QUIC congestion control algorithm. One of: `cubic`, `new_reno`, `bbr`. `cubic` is used by default.

auth_timeout.description: How long the server should wait for the client to send the authentication command. `3s` is used by default.

zero_rtt_handshake.description: Enable 0-RTT QUIC connection handshake on the client side. This is not impacting much on the performance, as the protocol is fully multiplexed. Disabling this is highly recommended, as it is vulnerable to replay attacks. See [Attack of the clones](https://blog.cloudflare.com/even-faster-connection-establishment-with-quic-0-rtt-resumption/#attack-of-the-clones).

heartbeat.description: Interval for sending heartbeat packets for keeping the connection alive. `10s` is used by default.

interface_name.description: Virtual device name, automatically selected if empty.

address.description: IPv4 and IPv6 prefix for the tun interface.

auto_route.description: Set the default route to the Tun. To avoid traffic loopback, set `route.auto_detect_interface`, `route.default_interface`, or `outbound.bind_interface`. `auto_redirect` is always recommended on Linux for better routing and performance, and to avoid conflicts with Docker bridge networks. On Android VPN, enable `route.override_android_vpn` so Tun traffic goes through the VPN.

iproute2_table_index.description: Linux iproute2 table index generated by `auto_route`. `2022` is used by default.

iproute2_rule_index.description: Linux iproute2 rule start index generated by `auto_route`. `9000` is used by default.

auto_redirect.description: Improve TUN routing and performance using nftables. Only supported on Linux with `auto_route` enabled; on Android only simple IPv4 TCP forwarding is performed due to missing nftables and ip6tables, and sharing your VPN connection over hotspot or repeater requires VPNHotspot (https://github.com/Mygod/VPNHotspot). auto_redirect automatically inserts compatibility rules into the OpenWrt fw4 table and conflicts with `route.default_mark` and `[dialOptions].routing_mark`.

auto_redirect_input_mark.description: Connection input mark used by `auto_redirect`. `0x2023` is used by default.

auto_redirect_output_mark.description: Connection output mark used by `auto_redirect`. `0x2024` is used by default.

auto_redirect_reset_mark.description: Connection reset mark used by `auto_redirect` pre-matching. `0x2025` is used by default.

auto_redirect_nfqueue.description: NFQueue number used by `auto_redirect` pre-matching. `100` is used by default.

exclude_mptcp.description: Only supported on Linux with nftables and requires `auto_route` and `auto_redirect` enabled. MPTCP cannot be transparently proxied due to protocol limitations. Such traffic is usually created by Apple systems. When enabled, MPTCP connections will bypass sing-box and connect directly, otherwise, will be rejected to avoid errors by default.

auto_redirect_iproute2_fallback_rule_ind.description: Linux iproute2 fallback rule index generated by `auto_redirect`. This rule is checked after system default rules (32766: main, 32767: default), routing traffic to the sing-box table only when no route is found in system tables. `32768` is used by default.

loopback_address.description: Loopback addresses make TCP connections to the specified address connect to the source address. Setting the option to `10.7.0.1` achieves the same behavior as SideStore/StosVPN, and with `auto_redirect` enabled the same behavior can be achieved for LAN devices as a gateway.

strict_route.description: Enforce strict routing rules when `auto_route` is enabled. On Linux, unsupported networks become unreachable and ICMP traffic does not pass through TUN unless `strict_route` or `auto_redirect` is enabled. On Windows, it also prevents DNS leaks caused by ordinary multihomed DNS resolution behavior and may break applications like VirtualBox in some cases.

route_address.description: Use custom routes instead of default when `auto_route` is enabled.

route_address_set.description: Add the destination IP CIDR rules in the specified rule-sets to the firewall when `auto_redirect` is enabled, so unmatched traffic bypasses the sing-box routes. Without `auto_redirect`, the rules are added to routes (equivalent to `route_address`), but Android graphical clients may not support this due to VpnService limits. Conflict with `route.default_mark` and `[dialOptions].routing_mark` when `auto_redirect` is enabled.

route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

route_exclude_address_set.description: Add the destination IP CIDR rules in the specified rule-sets to the firewall when `auto_redirect` is enabled, so matched traffic bypasses the sing-box routes. Without `auto_redirect`, the rules are added to routes (equivalent to `route_exclude_address`), but Android graphical clients may not support this due to VpnService limits. Conflict with `route.default_mark` and `[dialOptions].routing_mark` when `auto_redirect` is enabled.

include_interface.description: Limit interfaces in route. Interface rules are only supported on Linux and require `auto_route`. Conflict with `exclude_interface`.

exclude_interface.description: Exclude interfaces in route. When `strict_route` is enabled, return traffic to excluded interfaces will not be automatically excluded, so add them as well.

include_uid.description: Limit users in route. UID rules are only supported on Linux and require `auto_route`.

include_uid_range.description: Limit users in route, but in range. UID rules are only supported on Linux and require `auto_route`.

exclude_uid.description: Exclude users in route. UID rules are only supported on Linux and require `auto_route`.

exclude_uid_range.description: Exclude users in route, but in range. UID rules are only supported on Linux and require `auto_route`.

include_android_user.description: Limit android users in route. Android user rules are only supported on Android and require `auto_route`.

include_package.description: Limit android packages in route. Android package rules are only supported on Android and require `auto_route`.

exclude_package.description: Exclude android packages in route. Android package rules are only supported on Android and require `auto_route`.

stack.description: TCP/IP stack. `system` performs L3 to L4 translation using the system network stack, `gvisor` uses gVisor's virtual network stack, and `mixed` pairs the system TCP stack with gVisor's UDP stack. Defaults to `mixed` if the gVisor build tag is enabled, otherwise defaults to `system`.

platform.description: Platform-specific settings, provided by client applications.

bypass_domain.description: Hostnames that bypass the HTTP proxy. On Apple platforms, `bypass_domain` items match hostname suffixes.

match_domain.description: Hostnames that use the HTTP proxy. Only supported in graphical clients on Apple platforms.

inet4_address.description: IPv4 prefix for the tun interface.

inet6_address.description: IPv6 prefix for the tun interface.

inet4_route_address.description: Use custom routes instead of default when `auto_route` is enabled.

inet6_route_address.description: Use custom routes instead of default when `auto_route` is enabled.

inet4_route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

inet6_route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

endpoint_independent_nat.description: Enable endpoint-independent NAT. This item is only available on the gvisor stack; other stacks are endpoint-independent NAT by default. Performance may degrade slightly, so it is not recommended to enable when it is not needed.

RedirectInboundOptions.title: Redirect Inbound
RedirectInboundOptions.description: Redirect inbound is only supported on Linux and macOS.

network.description: Listen network, one of `tcp` `udp`. Both if empty.

Outbound.title: Outbound
Outbound.description: Outbound configuration entries define available transport protocols for upstream connections, identified by `type` and optionally tagged for route matching.

override_address.description: Override the connection destination address. Deprecated since sing-box 1.11.0 and will be removed in 1.13.0; see [Migration](/migration/#migrate-destination-override-fields-to-route-options).

override_port.description: Override the connection destination port. Deprecated since sing-box 1.11.0 and will be removed in 1.13.0; see [Migration](/migration/#migrate-destination-override-fields-to-route-options).

version.description: The SOCKS version, one of `4` `4a` `5`. SOCKS5 used by default.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both are enabled by default.

udp_over_tcp.description: UDP over TCP protocol settings. See [UDP Over TCP](/configuration/shared/udp-over-tcp/) for details.

enabled.description: Enable the UDP over TCP protocol (proprietary SagerNet extension).

HTTPOutboundOptions.title: HTTP Outbound
HTTPOutboundOptions.description: `http` outbound is a HTTP CONNECT proxy client.

method.description: Encryption method. Supported values include 2022 variants (`2022-blake3-*`), AES-GCM/ChaCha20, and legacy methods like AES-CTR/CFB, RC4-MD5, ChaCha20, and XChacha20.

plugin.description: Shadowsocks SIP003 plugin, implemented in internal. Only `obfs-local` and `v2ray-plugin` are supported.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both are enabled by default.

udp_over_tcp.description: UDP over TCP protocol settings. See [UDP Over TCP](/configuration/shared/udp-over-tcp/). Conflicts with `multiplex`.

min_streams.description: Minimum multiplexed streams in a connection before opening a new connection.

max_streams.description: Maximum multiplexed streams in a connection before opening a new connection.

security.description: Encryption methods: auto, none, zero, aes-128-gcm, chacha20-poly1305. Legacy encryption methods: aes-128-ctr.

alter_id.description: Alter ID. 0 uses AEAD protocol, 1 enables legacy protocol, and >1 is unused (same as 1).

global_padding.description: Protocol parameter. Will waste traffic randomly if enabled (enabled by default in v2ray and cannot be disabled).

authenticated_length.description: Protocol parameter. Enable length block encryption.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both is enabled by default.

packet_encoding.description: UDP packet encoding. Supported values: (none) disabled, packetaddr supported by v2ray 5+, xudp supported by xray.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both is enabled by default.

system_interface.description: Use system interface. Requires privilege and cannot conflict with existing system interfaces. Forced if gVisor is not included in the build.

gso.description: Try to enable generic segmentation offload. Deprecated in sing-box 1.11.0; GSO will be automatically enabled when available. Only supported on Linux.

interface_name.description: Custom interface name for system interface.

local_address.description: List of IP (v4 or v6) address prefixes to be assigned to the interface. Required.

private_key.description: WireGuard requires base64-encoded public and private keys. These can be generated using wg(8) or `sing-box generate wg-keypair`. Required.

peers.description: Multi-peer support. If enabled, `server`, `server_port`, `peer_public_key`, and `pre_shared_key` will be ignored.

peer_public_key.description: WireGuard peer public key. Required if multi-peer is disabled.

reserved.description: WireGuard reserved field bytes. `$outbound.reserved` will be used if empty.

workers.description: WireGuard worker count. CPU count is used by default.

mtu.description: WireGuard MTU. `1408` will be used if empty.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both is enabled by default.

server_ports.description: Server port range list. Conflicts with `server_port`. Since sing-box 1.12.0.

hop_interval.description: Port hopping interval. `30s` is used by default. Since sing-box 1.12.0.

up.description: Upstream bandwidth limit, format `[Integer] [Unit]` (e.g. `100 Mbps`). Supported units: bps, Bps, Kbps, KBps, Mbps, MBps, Gbps, GBps, Tbps, TBps. Required.

up_mbps.description: Max upstream bandwidth, in Mbps. Required.

down.description: Downstream bandwidth limit, format `[Integer] [Unit]` (e.g. `100 Mbps`). Supported units: bps, Bps, Kbps, KBps, Mbps, MBps, Gbps, GBps, Tbps, TBps. Required.

down_mbps.description: Max downstream bandwidth, in Mbps. Required.

recv_window_conn.description: The QUIC stream-level flow control window for receiving data. `15728640 (15 MB/s)` will be used if empty.

recv_window.description: The QUIC connection-level flow control window for receiving data. `67108864 (64 MB/s)` will be used if empty.

disable_mtu_discovery.description: Disables Path MTU Discovery (RFC 8899). Packets will then be at most 1252 (IPv4) / 1232 (IPv6) bytes in size. Force enabled on for systems other than Linux and Windows.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both are enabled by default.

version.description:
ShadowTLS protocol version.

| Value         | Protocol Version                                                                        |
|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `1` (default) | [ShadowTLS v1](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-en.md#v1) |
| `2`           | [ShadowTLS v2](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-en.md#v2) |
| `3`           | [ShadowTLS v3](https://github.com/ihciah/shadow-tls/blob/master/docs/protocol-v3-en.md) |

password.description: Set password. Only available in the ShadowTLS v2/v3 protocol.

idle_session_check_interval.description: Interval checking for idle sessions. Default: 30s.

idle_session_timeout.description: In the check, close sessions that have been idle for longer than this. Default: 30s.

min_idle_session.description: In the check, at least the first `n` idle sessions are kept open. Default value: `n`=0.

server_ports.description: Server port range list. Conflicts with `server_port`. Since sing-box 1.11.0.

hop_interval.description: Port hopping interval. `30s` is used by default. Since sing-box 1.11.0.

up_mbps.description: Max bandwidth, in Mbps. If empty, the BBR congestion control algorithm is used instead of Hysteria CC.

down_mbps.description: Max bandwidth, in Mbps. If empty, the BBR congestion control algorithm is used instead of Hysteria CC.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both are enabled by default.

brutal_debug.description: Enable debug information logging for Hysteria Brutal CC.

congestion_control.description: QUIC congestion control algorithm. One of: `cubic`, `new_reno`, `bbr`. `cubic` is used by default.

udp_relay_mode.description: UDP packet relay mode. `native` is used by default. `native` provides native UDP characteristics, while `quic` provides lossless UDP relay using QUIC streams at the cost of additional overhead. Conflict with `udp_over_stream`.

udp_over_stream.description: This is the TUIC port of the [UDP over TCP protocol](/configuration/shared/udp-over-tcp/), designed to provide a QUIC stream based UDP relay mode that TUIC does not provide. Since it is an add-on protocol, you will need to use sing-box or another program compatible with the protocol as a server. This mode has no positive effect in a proper UDP proxy scenario and should only be applied to relay streaming UDP traffic (basically QUIC streams). Conflict with `udp_relay_mode`.

zero_rtt_handshake.description: Enable 0-RTT QUIC connection handshake on the client side. This is not impacting much on the performance, as the protocol is fully multiplexed. Disabling this is highly recommended, as it is vulnerable to replay attacks. See [Attack of the clones](https://blog.cloudflare.com/even-faster-connection-establishment-with-quic-0-rtt-resumption/#attack-of-the-clones).

heartbeat.description: Interval for sending heartbeat packets for keeping the connection alive. `10s` is used by default.

network.description: Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both is enabled by default.
Enabled network. One of `tcp` `udp`. Both is enabled by default.

packet_encoding.description: UDP packet encoding, xudp is used by default. Supported values: (none) disables it, packetaddr is supported by v2ray 5+, and xudp is supported by xray.

user.description: SSH user, root will be used if empty.

host_key.description: Host key. Accept any if empty.

client_version.description: Client version. Random version will be used if empty.

executable_path.description: The path to the Tor executable. Embedded Tor will be ignored if set.

extra_args.description: List of extra arguments passed to the Tor instance when started.

data_directory.description: Recommended. The data directory of Tor. Each start will be very slow if not specified.

torrc.description: Map of torrc options. See tor(1) for details.

outbounds.description: List of outbound tags to select.

default.description: The default outbound tag. The first outbound will be used if empty.

interrupt_exist_connections.description: Interrupt existing connections when the selected outbound has changed. Only inbound connections are affected by this setting, internal connections will always be interrupted.

outbounds.description: List of outbound tags to test.

url.description: The URL to test. `https://www.gstatic.com/generate_204` will be used if empty.

interval.description: The test interval. `3m` will be used if empty.

tolerance.description: The test tolerance in milliseconds. `50` will be used if empty.

idle_timeout.description: The idle timeout. `30m` will be used if empty.

interrupt_exist_connections.description: Interrupt existing connections when the selected outbound has changed. Only inbound connections are affected by this setting, internal connections will always be interrupted.

final.description: Default outbound tag. The first outbound will be used if empty.

find_process.description: Find process info for each connection.

auto_detect_interface.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows and macOS. Bind outbound connections to the default NIC by default to prevent routing loops under tun. Takes no effect if `outbound.bind_interface` is set.

override_android_vpn.description: Only supported on Android. Accept Android VPN as upstream NIC when `auto_detect_interface` enabled.

default_interface.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows and macOS. Bind outbound connections to the specified NIC by default to prevent routing loops under tun. Takes no effect if `auto_detect_interface` is set.

default_mark.description: Only supported on Linux. Set routing mark by default. Takes no effect if `outbound.routing_mark` is set.

default_domain_resolver.description: See [Dial Fields](/configuration/shared/dial/#domain_resolver) for details. Can be overrides by `outbound.domain_resolver`.

default_network_strategy.description: See [Dial Fields](/configuration/shared/dial/#network_strategy) for details. Takes no effect if `outbound.bind_interface`, `outbound.inet4_bind_address` or `outbound.inet6_bind_address` is set. Can be overrides by `outbound.network_strategy`. Conflicts with `default_interface`.

method.description: `default`: Reply with TCP RST for TCP connections, and ICMP port unreachable for UDP packets. `drop`: Drop packets.

no_drop.description: If not enabled, `method` will be temporarily overwritten to `drop` after 50 triggers in 30s.

sniffer.description: Enabled sniffers. All sniffers enabled by default. Available protocol values can be found in Protocol Sniff (/configuration/route/sniff/).

timeout.description: Timeout for sniffing. `300ms` is used by default.

action.description: Resolve request destination from domain to IP addresses.

server.description: Specifies DNS server tag to use instead of selecting through DNS routing.

strategy.description: DNS resolution strategy, available values are: `prefer_ipv4`, `prefer_ipv6`, `ipv4_only`, `ipv6_only`. `dns.strategy` will be used by default.

disable_cache.description: Disable cache and save cache in this query.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default. If the value is an IP address instead of a prefix, `/32` or `/128` will be appended automatically. Will override `dns.client_subnet`.

__schema107.description: Since sing-box 1.13.0, you can match ICMP echo (ping) requests via the new `icmp` network. Such traffic originates from `TUN`, `WireGuard`, and `Tailscale` inbounds and can be routed to `Direct`, `WireGuard`, and `Tailscale` outbounds. Match network type. `tcp`, `udp` or `icmp`.

__schema109.description: Username, see each inbound for details.

__schema110.description: Sniffed protocol, see [Protocol Sniff](/configuration/route/sniff/) for details.

__schema112.description: Sniffed client type, see [Protocol Sniff](/configuration/route/sniff/) for details.

__schema133.description: Match process path using regular expression.

__schema139.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Match if network is considered Metered (on Android) or considered expensive, such as Cellular or a Personal Hotspot (on Apple platforms).

__schema140.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Apple platforms. Match if network is in Low Data Mode.

__schema141.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms, or on Linux. Match WiFi SSID. See [Wi-Fi State](/configuration/shared/wifi-state/) for details.

__schema142.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms, or on Linux. Match WiFi BSSID. See [Wi-Fi State](/configuration/shared/wifi-state/) for details.

__schema143.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Match interface address.

__schema144.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Matches network interface (same values as `network_type`) address.

__schema145.description: Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Match default interface address.

__schema146.description: Match specified outbounds' preferred routes. `tailscale` matches MagicDNS domains and peers' allowed IPs. `wireguard` matches peers' allowed IPs.

__schema148.description: Make `ip_cidr` in rule-sets match the source IP.

__schema149.description: Deprecated in sing-box 1.10.0. `rule_set_ipcidr_match_source` is renamed to `rule_set_ip_cidr_match_source` and will be remove in sing-box 1.11.0. Make `ip_cidr` in rule-sets match the source IP.

__schema154.description: See Dial Fields (/configuration/shared/dial/#network_strategy) for details. Only take effect if outbound is direct without `outbound.bind_interface`, `outbound.inet4_bind_address` and `outbound.inet6_bind_address` set.

__schema157.description: If enabled, for UDP proxy requests addressed to a domain, the original packet address will be sent in the response instead of the mapped domain.

__schema158.description: If enabled, attempts to connect UDP connection to the destination instead of listen.

__schema159.description: Timeout for UDP connections. Setting a larger value than the UDP timeout in inbounds will have no effect. Default values for sniffed connections: `10s` for `dns`, `ntp`, `stun`; `30s` for `quic`, `dtls`. If no protocol is sniffed, ports `53`, `123`, `443`, and `3478` will be recognized as `dns`, `ntp`, `quic`, and `stun`, respectively.

__schema160.description: Fragment TLS handshakes to bypass firewalls. This feature is intended to circumvent simple firewalls based on plaintext packet matching, and should not be used to circumvent real censorship. Due to poor performance, try `tls_record_fragment` first, and only apply to server names known to be blocked. On Linux, Apple platforms, (administrator privileges required) Windows, the wait time can be automatically detected. Otherwise, it will fall back to waiting for a fixed time specified by `tls_fragment_fallback_delay`. In addition, if the actual wait time is less than 20ms, it will also fall back to waiting for a fixed time because the target is considered to be local or behind a transparent proxy.

__schema161.description: The fallback value used when TLS segmentation cannot automatically determine the wait time. `500ms` is used by default.

__schema162.description: Fragment TLS handshake into multiple TLS records to bypass firewalls.

__schema163.description: Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Match network type. Available values: `wifi`, `cellular`, `ethernet` and `other`.

process_name.description: Match process name. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

process_path.description: Match process path. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

process_path_regex.description: Match process path using regular expression. Only supported on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

network_type.description: Match network type. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms. Available values: `wifi`, `cellular`, `ethernet` and `other`.

network_is_expensive.description: Match if network is considered Metered (on Android) or considered expensive, such as Cellular or a Personal Hotspot (on Apple platforms). Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms.

network_is_constrained.description: Match if network is in Low Data Mode. Only supported in graphical clients on Apple platforms.

wifi_ssid.description: Match WiFi SSID. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms.

wifi_bssid.description: Match WiFi BSSID. Only supported in graphical clients on Android and Apple platforms.

network_interface_address.description: Matches network interface (same values as `network_type`) address.

__schema165.description: DNS query type. Values can be integers or type name strings.

format.description: Format of rule-set file, `source` or `binary`. Optional when `path` or `url` uses `json` or `srs` as extension.

path.description: File path of rule-set. Will be automatically reloaded if the file is modified since sing-box 1.10.0.

format.description: Format of rule-set file, `source` or `binary`. Optional when `path` or `url` uses `json` or `srs` as extension.

download_detour.description: Tag of the outbound to download rule-set. Default outbound will be used if empty.

update_interval.description: Update interval of rule-set. `1d` will be used if empty.

GeoIPOptions.title: GeoIP
GeoIPOptions.description: GeoIP is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.12.0, check Migration.

path.description: The path to the sing-geoip database.

download_url.description: The download URL of the sing-geoip database.

download_detour.description: The tag of the outbound to download the database.

GeositeOptions.title: Geosite
GeositeOptions.description: Geosite is deprecated and will be removed in sing-box 1.12.0, check Migration.

path.description: The path to the sing-geosite database.

download_url.description: The download URL of the sing-geoip database.

download_detour.description: The tag of the outbound to download the database.

Service.title: Service
Service.description: Service entries configure supplemental services such as DERP, Resolved, and SSM API introduced in sing-box 1.12.0.

CCMServiceOptions.title: CCM
CCMServiceOptions.description: CCM (Claude Code Multiplexer) service is a multiplexing service that allows you to access your local Claude Code subscription remotely through custom tokens.

credential_path.description:
Path to the Claude Code OAuth credentials file. If not specified, defaults to:
- `$CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR/.credentials.json` if `CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR` environment variable is set
- `~/.claude/.credentials.json` otherwise
On macOS, credentials are read from the system keychain first, then fall back to the file if unavailable. Refreshed tokens are automatically written back to the same location.

users.description: List of authorized users for token authentication. If empty, no authentication is required. Claude Code authenticates by setting the `ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN` environment variable to their token value.

token.description: Bearer token for authentication. Clients authenticate by setting the `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header.

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to send to the Claude API. These headers will override any existing headers with the same name.

usages_path.description:
Path to the file for storing aggregated API usage statistics. Usage tracking is disabled if not specified. When enabled, the service tracks and saves comprehensive statistics including:
- Request counts
- Token usage (input, output, cache read, cache creation)
- Calculated costs in USD based on Claude API pricing
Statistics are organized by model, context window (200k standard vs 1M premium), and optionally by user when authentication is enabled. The statistics file is automatically saved every minute and upon service shutdown.

DERPServiceOptions.title: DERP
DERPServiceOptions.description: DERP service is a Tailscale DERP server, similar to derper.

verify_client_endpoint.description: Tailscale endpoints tags to verify clients.

home.description: What to serve at the root path. It may be left empty (the default, for a default homepage), `blank` for a blank page, or a URL to redirect to.

mesh_with.description:
Mesh with other DERP servers. Object format:
{
  "server": "",
  "server_port": "",
  "host": "",
  "tls": {},
  ... // Dial Fields
}
Object fields:
- `server`: **Required** DERP server address.
- `server_port`: **Required** DERP server port.
- `host`: Custom DERP hostname.
- `tls`: [TLS](/configuration/shared/tls/#outbound)
- `Dial Fields`: [Dial Fields](/configuration/shared/dial/)

mesh_psk_file.description: Pre-shared key file for DERP mesh.

stun.description:
STUN server listen options. Object format:
{
  "enabled": true,
  ... // Listen Fields
}
Object fields:
- `enabled`: **Required** Enable STUN server.
- `listen`: **Required** STUN server listen address, default to `::`.
- `listen_port`: **Required** STUN server listen port, default to `3478`.
- `other Listen Fields`: [Listen Fields](/configuration/shared/listen/)
Setting `stun` value to a number `__PORT__` is equivalent to configuring:
{ "enabled": true, "listen_port": __PORT__ }

OCMServiceOptions.title: OCM
OCMServiceOptions.description: OCM (OpenAI Codex Multiplexer) service is a multiplexing service that allows you to access your local OpenAI Codex subscription remotely through custom tokens.

credential_path.description: Path to the OpenAI OAuth credentials file. If not specified, defaults to `~/.codex/auth.json`. Refreshed tokens are automatically written back to the same location.

users.description: List of authorized users for token authentication. If empty, no authentication is required.

token.description: Bearer token for authentication. Clients authenticate by setting the `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header.

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to send to the OpenAI API. These headers will override any existing headers with the same name.

usages_path.description:
Path to the file for storing aggregated API usage statistics. Usage tracking is disabled if not specified. When enabled, the service tracks and saves comprehensive statistics including:
- Request counts
- Token usage (input, output, cached)
- Calculated costs in USD based on OpenAI API pricing
Statistics are organized by model and optionally by user when authentication is enabled. The statistics file is automatically saved every minute and upon service shutdown.

OOMKillerServiceOptions.title: OOM Killer Service
OOMKillerServiceOptions.description: The OOM Killer service monitors memory usage and terminates the process when it exceeds the configured limit, preventing system-level out-of-memory conditions.

memory_limit.description: The memory limit that triggers OOM killing. Accepts human-readable byte sizes such as `128MiB` or `1GiB`. When memory usage exceeds this threshold, the OOM killer becomes active.

safety_margin.description: An additional memory buffer subtracted from the limit before enforcement. Accepts human-readable byte sizes such as `32MiB`. Provides headroom to avoid aggressive killing.

min_interval.description: The minimum interval between consecutive OOM kill checks. Accepts a duration string such as `1s`. Prevents excessive kill frequency.

max_interval.description: The maximum interval between consecutive OOM kill checks. Accepts a duration string such as `30s`. The interval is dynamically adjusted between `min_interval` and `max_interval`.

checks_before_limit.description: The number of consecutive checks that must exceed the memory limit before the OOM killer takes action. Reduces false positives from transient memory spikes.

ResolvedServiceOptions.title: Resolved
ResolvedServiceOptions.description: Resolved service is a fake systemd-resolved DBUS service to receive DNS settings from other programs (e.g. NetworkManager) and provide DNS resolution.

SSMAPIServiceOptions.title: SSM API
SSMAPIServiceOptions.description: SSM API service is a RESTful API server for managing Shadowsocks servers.

tag.description: Tag of the SSM API service.

servers.description: A mapping Object from HTTP endpoints to [Shadowsocks Inbound](/configuration/inbound/shadowsocks) tags. Selected Shadowsocks inbounds must be configured with [managed](/configuration/inbound/shadowsocks#managed) enabled.

cache_path.description: If set, when the server is about to stop, traffic and user state will be saved to the specified JSON file to be restored on the next startup.

ExperimentalOptions.title: Experimental
ExperimentalOptions.description: Experimental features such as cache_file, Clash API, V2Ray API, and debug options.

CacheFileOptions.title: Cache File
CacheFileOptions.description: Cache file settings control enabling the cache, file path, cache id, fakeip storage, rejected DNS response cache, and rdrc timeout.

path.description: Path to the cache file. `cache.db` will be used if empty.

cache_id.description: Identifier in the cache file. If not empty, configuration specified data will use a separate store keyed by it.

store_fakeip.description: Store fakeip in the cache file.

store_rdrc.description: Store rejected DNS response cache in the cache file. The check results of [Address filter DNS rule items](/configuration/dns/rule/#address-filter-fields) will be cached until expiration.

rdrc_timeout.description: Timeout of rejected DNS response cache. `7d` is used by default.

ClashAPIOptions.title: Clash API
ClashAPIOptions.description: Clash API settings configure the RESTful controller, optional external UI, secret, default mode, CORS origins, and private network access.

external_controller.description: RESTful web API listening address. Clash API will be disabled if empty.

external_ui.description: A relative path to the configuration directory or an absolute path to a directory in which you put some static web resource. sing-box will then serve it at `http://{{external-controller}}/ui`.

external_ui_download_url.description: ZIP download URL for the external UI, will be used if the specified `external_ui` directory is empty. `https://github.com/MetaCubeX/Yacd-meta/archive/gh-pages.zip` will be used if empty.

external_ui_download_detour.description: The tag of the outbound to download the external UI. Default outbound will be used if empty.

secret.description: Secret for the RESTful API (optional). Authenticate by specifying HTTP header `Authorization: Bearer ${secret}`. ALWAYS set a secret if RESTful API is listening on 0.0.0.0.

default_mode.description: Default mode in clash, `Rule` will be used if empty. This setting has no direct effect, but can be used in routing and DNS rules via the `clash_mode` rule item.

access_control_allow_origin.description: CORS allowed origins, `*` will be used if empty. To access the Clash API on a private network from a public website, you must explicitly specify it in `access_control_allow_origin` instead of using `*`.

access_control_allow_private_network.description: Allow access from private network. To access the Clash API on a private network from a public website, `access_control_allow_private_network` must be enabled.

V2RayAPIOptions.title: V2Ray API
V2RayAPIOptions.description: V2Ray API settings control the optional gRPC API and its traffic statistics service for inbounds, outbounds, and users.

listen.description: gRPC API listening address. V2Ray API will be disabled if empty.

memory_limit.description: Memory limit in bytes, e.g. `128MiB`, see https://pkg.go.dev/runtime/debug#SetMemoryLimit.

oom_killer.description: **Removed in v1.13.0.** This field is no longer supported and will return an error if set. Use the `oom-killer` service instead.
